title: Turn Fiddlesticks W into Lucian passive or Swain Q
body: Lucian Passive would switch to another target if the first hit kills it. This is also the same with Swain Q. Both abilities switch targets as long as the duration is still going. I'm wondering if this will be good for Fiddle W. It would tremendously help with wraiths and overall jungle clearing, though I feel like it will be too strong when killing lane minions, so its damage might get reduced if this change will be applied.

replies.body: Having it switch targets for full duration would be fine, even on champs.

I don't remember If there was any official stance on that, but I'd guess it would be OP in duels. If there was nothing else to bounce off, you just Q them to give them basically very little space to react, E+W and they are taking giant amount of damage for free.

2 seconds (approximately):
W 160 - 360 (+90%AP)
E 130 - 290 (+90%AP)
Total 290 - 650 (180%AP)

Currently (approximately):
W 160 - 360 (+90%AP)
E 65 - 145 (+45%AP)
Total 225 - 505 (+135%AP)

Difference 65 - 145 (+45%AP), saving 12 - 10 - 6 seconds of Cooldown and 50 - 90 Mana.

Now it doesn't look that much more OP in the scenario where enemy reacts and cancels the tether immediately, but it might have proven during tests to be oppressive lategame and giving very little counter.

Actually this would be of immense help for lane fiddle, where he is also subpar. Lane fiddle doesn't have good waveclear or a good way to kill minions. He either maxes his e which is not that great at clearing while also losing the strength of his w, or maxes his w and gets shoved in and loses cs.

This is the only change Fiddle has needed for ages. I don't know why they thought barely buffing the base damage of his W would help when he has 2 points in it at rank 3 and it's already barely higher than the old damage at that point. 

The drain switching would buff jungle Fiddle without putting lane Fiddle in a dangerous position that gets jungle Fiddle nerfed.
would make his laning insane. he would farm creeps so easy
Not really? Have you seen the mana cost on Drain and the fact that he needs to stand still for it? Dark Wind better waveclear in general because it's safer and farther range.

but its less reliable, because it bounces to targets it hasnt hit yet as priority. if you have a LOT of ap, ya dark wind works, but if the drain would auto target after killing something, it would be a go to for farming. obviously it has the downsides you listed, but thats no matter what. if you end up against a lux or morgana or someone else that cant cc you out of it, you can just drain tank it
it would help his jgl more so, not sure thats a good thing, his e is pretty good at farming jgl creeps

considering you normally go through the entire drain before killing something, not really. it could help with raptors the most, just start lasering all of the little ones, but raptors are meant to be hard for someone like fid who is mostly single target. giving him an auto target laser will make that too easy
He needs jungle help though, so shoring up one of his weaknesses would be a good way to do that.

but what would you trade off for it, fiddle ( as annoying as he is ) is pretty well balanced and if you wanted to increase his AoE dmg, how would you pay for it, there would have to be a cost somewhere to keep him on an even keel.

He's doing a little bit below average right now actually. He has a fairly low play rate and a sub-par win rate even with experienced players. This change wouldn't directly impact his ability to fight other players and would just help with his sustain and clears slightly in niche cases. This wouldn't be an increase in AoE damage at all, all it would do is allow him to be a little less picky about his target selection on his W.

That is his weakness/counterplay he has to be discriminate with his drain and terror to make up for darkwind and crowstorm. If his drain is made AoE would you make his darkwind single target? A low pllay rate is not always an indicator or weakness, just less broken.

You keep saying his drain would be AoE when that's not what this is proposing at all, it would not do damage to more than one target at a time. It would remain single target but would allow for switching targets mid duration if the current target dies. This likely wouldn't even increase his overall damage.

His play rate is very low (~1%) which is less than just "not Flavor of the Month".  Fidd is a champ who can basically only play jungle yet his play and win rate are more on par with champs like Rumble and Talon, who were never intended to play jungle and are extremely off meta.

Im often the highest damage output on my team as support.  Ge doesnt have old Zyras output capability but its more reliable now and effective from a distance.  Fid also has manu sneaky support like answers to enemy attacks eith his fear, drain, and silence bounce.  

I like to rush slow items and an HP item on him as support afterwards.  The blue active slow on the support item is nice on fid as is Ryalis, but sometimes Ill go RoA instead or Zhonyas depending on opposition comp. And ability

I get demonized by some adcs but those with an open mind are often surprised by fiddles control in lane as support.  It does vamp some cs away but Fid can easily zone enemies from farming and E spam grind them down so they are scared to engage due to hp disadvantage.

I've been trying it lately (somewhat to troll but also because I maintain it has promise) and you can get some nasty poke out with a thunderlords and one good bounce. Plus you're still holding one of the last point-and-click CC's left in the game, very useful for junglers or roaming mid-assassins. Close-ranged yes, but the value of a definite, **get the hell away from my carry** ability cannot be underappreciated on a support.

Also, a rarity among supports, given a little time alone with a cannon minion or just running up to deal with scuttle for a bit and you can restore a lot of health even if you get low.

Personally I'll try to poke and generally protect my carry until 6, at which point I try to roam mid for a gank, they simply never see it coming. Botlane rarely sees the ult coming either, to be fair, I've been pushed up to turret and decided to ult right over the wall at them. I dunno why they don't expect it- just because I'm going support doesn't mean I won't use my ult.

If you change his drain, you really screw Fiddlesticks.  What make Fiddlesticks a unique champion from others? Well, he is not an action per second clicker,  he is more of a decision maker.  If you change his core style, you might as well create a new champion instead.

They'd have to nerf the damage and healing slightly, otherwise his clear speed would go through the roof (just imagine power clearing raptors and krugs with it)

Within a team fight situation, I think it would only be mildly beneficial since there are very few cases as fiddlesticks where one actually runs out the full duration on drain (and with enough CDR, it's on greater than 100% uptime anyway). The only real advantage I see from it is reducing his late game mana costs, at which point I'd prefer a more direct buff anyway, not something finicky and situational.
